thread.title: The U-17 teams of Chile and South Africa draw in Quilín
thread.title_full: The U-17 teams of Chile and South Africa draw in Quilín - Oximity

author: Content Admin
title: The U-17 teams of Chile and South Africa draw in Quilín
text:
The U-17 teams of Chile and South Africa draw in Quilín
In an intense match played in Stadium 3 of the Quilín Sports Complex, the U-17 teams of Chile and South African fought to a scoreless draw in what was the penultimate friendly before the World Cup, which begins October 17.
Unable to play the way they did against Mexico at the National Stadium, the youngsters this time had some trouble containing the speedy and pragmatic African team.
In the 19th minute Ignacio Azua jumped to the lower left corner of the arc to bat-away a penalty kick by Wiseman Meyiwa int he most dangerous effort by the Africans.
The second half was substantially better for Chile. Organized on the pitch and with some changes, the team led by Miguel Ponce took advantage to put pressure on the opponent, who was forced to resort to rough play to stop the advance of the Chileans.
Chile will play its last friendly against England on Sunday, to be played at 6:00 pm at the Estadio El Teniente of Rancagua . The team debuts at the WC against Croatia in the Nacional Stadium.
Source: ANFP
